ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Average motor activity score of subject
Notes: Mean of motor score across the 4 blocks of stimuli (2 visual, 2 auditory)

ElementDescription: Average positive affect score of participant
Notes: Mean of positive affect across the 4 blocks of stimuli (2 visual, 2 auditory)

ElementDescription: Average negative affect score of participant
Notes: Mean of negative affect across the 4 blocks of stimuli (2 visual, 2 auditory)

ElementDescription: motor score for visual 1 stimuli
Notes: 1= little to no motor activity; 2= rare motor activity; 3= motor activity less than half the time; 4= average amount of movement; 5= motor activity more than half the time; 6= heightened motor activity most of the time; 7= intense gross motor activity (including back arching, body twisting, and hyperextensions of the arms and legs)

ElementDescription: positive affect score for visual 1 stimuli
Notes: 1= little to no positive vocalizations; 2= rarely exhibits positive vocalizations; 3= responds with positive vocalizations less than half the time and mild instances; 4= limited positive vocalizations; 5=  fair amount of positive vocalization; 6= responds with positive vocalizations most of the time; 7= responds with many positive vocalizations (lots of gurgling, cooing, and smiling during stimulus presentation)

ElementDescription: negative affect score for visual 1 stimuli
Notes: 1= little to no negative affect; 2= rarely exhibits negative affect; 3= responds with negative affect less than half the time and typically mild instances; 4= limited negative affect; 5= fair amount of negative affect; 6= responds with negative affect most of the time; 7= responds with intense negative affect; cries or fusses continuously during the majority of the stimulus presentation

ElementDescription: motor score for auditory 1 stimuli
Notes: 1= little to no motor activity; 2= rare motor activity; 3= motor activity less than half the time; 4= average amount of movement; 5= motor activity more than half the time; 6= heightened motor activity most of the time; 7= intense gross motor activity (including back arching, body twisting, and hyperextensions of the arms and legs)

ElementDescription: positive affect score for auditory 1 stimuli

ElementDescription: negative affect score for auditory 1 stimuli
Notes: 1= little to no negative affect; 2= rarely exhibits negative affect; 3= responds with negative affect less than half the time and typically mild instances; 4= limited negative affect; 5= fair amount of negative affect; 6= responds with negative affect most of the time; 7= responds with intense negative affect; cries or fusses continuously during the majority of the stimulus presentation
